clinical_trials.summary: Research on paracetamol continues to focus on its role in postoperative care, with emerging interest in its potential impact on specific complications like postoperative delirium. A significant trend involves ongoing investigation and meta-analyses into the potential neurodevelopmental effects associated with prenatal and postnatal exposure to paracetamol, particularly concerning autism spectrum and attention-deficit/hyperactivity symptoms. Additionally, fundamental research explores its effects on liver physiology, including in the context of regeneration and toxicity.

top_papers.title: Fourth Consensus Guidelines for the Management of Postoperative Nausea and Vomiting.
Prenatal and postnatal exposure to acetaminophen in relation to autism spectrum and attention-deficit and hyperactivity symptoms in childhood: Meta-analysis in six European population-based cohorts.
Multimodal decoding of human liver regeneration.
Prenatal paracetamol exposure and child neurodevelopment: A review.
